name: playwright_network_requests
description: Intercept, mock, and monitor network traffic

args: const { chromium } = require('playwright'); (async () => { const browser = await chromium.launch(); const page = await browser.newPage(); page.on('request', req => console.log('→', req.method(), req.url())); page.on('response', res => console.log('←', res.status(), res.url())); await page.goto('https://example.com'); await browser.close(); })();

expected_output.example:
→ GET https://example.com/
← 200 https://example.com/

Network traffic monitored

args: const { chromium } = require('playwright'); (async () => { const browser = await chromium.launch(); const page = await browser.newPage(); await page.route('**/*.{png,jpg,jpeg}', route => route.abort()); await page.goto('https://example.com'); console.log('Images blocked'); await browser.close(); })();

const { chromium } = require('playwright'); (async () => { const browser = await chromium.launch(); const page = await browser.newPage(); await page.route('**/api/data', route => route.fulfill({status: 200, body: JSON.stringify({mocked: true})})); await page.goto('https://example.com'); console.log('API response mocked'); await browser.close(); })();

expected_output.example:
API response mocked

Mock response injected
